ICING ON THE CAKE Bundesliga giants Borussia Dortmund evacuate their headquarters as firefighters are called to investigate suspicious white powder 
The German side were sent the substance in an envelope, but thankfully it turned out to not be serious after an investigation By Jake Lambourne 15th March 2017, 8:00 pm Updated: 15th March 2017, 8:00 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments 40 FIREFIGHTERS had to be called in to investigate suspicious white powder after Borussia Dortmund evacuated their headquarters. 
The German side discovered the substance when staff members found the contents inside an envelope that was sent to the club. Getty Images 3 The Borussia Dortmund headquarters had to be evacuated after a suspicious white powder was found in an envelope 
There were fears that it would spark a chemical terror attack, similar to what happened in the United States in 2001. 
Keep up to date with ALL the FOOTBALL news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
One week after the September 11 terror attacks, letters containing anthrax spores were sent to politicians and news outlets – killing five people and injuring 17. 
Thankfully it turned out to be an elaborate hoax, with the powder being confirmed as icing sugar. Getty Images Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang has had an excellent season for the German side, and is the top goalscorer in the Bundesliga MOST READ IN SPORT Liverpool and Arsenal fear being robbed of Champions League spot by Manchester United and Leicester Ron's Real nemesis Cristiano Ronaldo and a host of Real Madrid stars' futures could be under threat as Monchi comes in CAN'T KEEP CALM AND CARRA ON Hilarious moment Jamie Carragher snaps at Jamie Redknapp for interrupting his expert analysis on Sky Sports Brawl in Brazil Chaos in Brazil as local derby erupts into a mass fight between players and fans out on their own Luke Shaw, Anthony Martial and Bastian Schweinsteiger sent to train on their own at Manchester United Kante Keep Him Away N'Golo Kante celebrates Leicester's Champions League win over Sevilla from King Power stands Getty Images 3 Borussia Dortmund players celebrate netting against Benfica in their Champions League Round of 16 second leg victory 
In an official club statement, Borussia Dortmund said: “Big thanks to the Dortmund fire brigade. We recieved a suspicious envelope with white powder today. 
“For security reasons, we evacuated the building completely for about one hour. The powder was investigated in a mobile laboratory. 
“We got the results at 17:20: icing sugar. Right now, all Borussia staff are working again.” 
Only recently was there a suspicious package sent to Real Madrid president Florentino Perez , which ultimately proved to be harmless. Violence breaks out between Borussia Dortmund and RB Leipzig fans
